questions.question: What is a program made of according to the slides?
options: Common elements in a programming language
questions.explanation: A program is made of common elements in a programming language.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common element in a programming language?
questions.explanation: Motherboard is hardware, not a programming language element.

questions.question: Keywords in a programming language are also known as?
questions.explanation: Keywords are reserved words with predefined meanings.

questions.question: Which of the following C++ words is a keyword?
questions.explanation: Return is a reserved keyword in C++.

questions.question: Why can keywords not be used as variable names?
questions.explanation: Keywords already have special meanings defined by the language.

questions.question: What are programmer-defined identifiers?
questions.explanation: Identifiers are names created by programmers.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a variable identifier?
questions.explanation: courseCredit is a programmer-defined identifier.

questions.question: Which rule applies to programmer-defined identifiers?
options: Must begin with a letter or underscore
questions.explanation: Identifiers must start with a letter or underscore.

questions.question: Which of the following identifiers is invalid?
questions.explanation: Identifiers cannot begin with a digit.

questions.question: Identifiers are case-sensitive in?
questions.explanation: Some programming languages treat identifiers as case-sensitive.

questions.question: What is an operator?
options: A symbol used to perform operations
questions.explanation: Operators perform operations on values or variables.

questions.question: Which of the following is an arithmetic operator?
questions.explanation: + is used for addition.

questions.question: What is the result of integer division 3 / 2?
questions.explanation: Integer division truncates the remainder.

questions.question: Which operator is used to compare two values?
questions.explanation: == compares two values.

questions.question: Which logical operator returns true only if both conditions are true?
questions.explanation: Logical AND (&&) requires both conditions to be true.

questions.question: What does the NOT (!) operator do?
questions.explanation: NOT reverses the truth of a condition.

questions.question: Which operator assigns a value to a variable?
questions.explanation: = assigns a value.

questions.question: Unary operators require how many operands?
questions.explanation: Unary operators operate on a single operand.

questions.question: Which operator is a unary operator?
questions.explanation: ++ is a unary increment operator.

questions.question: Unary operators are commonly used in?
questions.explanation: Unary operators are commonly used in loops.

questions.question: Which punctuation mark is used to terminate statements in C++, Java, and JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Semicolons are used to terminate statements in many programming languages.

questions.question: Which punctuation mark is used to separate elements in a list?
questions.explanation: Commas separate items such as function arguments or array elements.

questions.question: Which punctuation mark is used to access members of a class or object?
questions.explanation: The period (dot) accesses object or class members.

questions.question: Quotation marks are used to define?
questions.explanation: Quotation marks define string or character literals.

questions.question: What is syntax in programming?
questions.explanation: Syntax refers to grammar rules of a programming language.

questions.question: Which of the following is controlled by syntax?
questions.explanation: Syntax controls how keywords, operators, and punctuation are used.

questions.question: Each programming language has?
questions.explanation: Each programming language defines its own syntax.

questions.question: What is a character set?
options: A set of valid characters in a language
questions.explanation: A character set defines all valid characters recognized by a language.

questions.question: Which of the following belongs to a character set?
questions.explanation: Digits are part of a programming language character set.

questions.question: Which is NOT part of a character set?
questions.explanation: Keywords are language elements, not characters.

questions.question: What is a constant?
options: A value that changes during execution
A value that cannot be altered
questions.explanation: Constants retain fixed values during program execution.

questions.question: Which is a characteristic of constants?
questions.explanation: Constants cannot be changed once assigned.

questions.question: Which of the following is a numeric literal constant?
questions.explanation: 42 is a numeric literal constant.

questions.question: Which is a character literal?
questions.explanation: Character literals are enclosed in single quotes.

questions.question: Which is a Boolean literal?
questions.explanation: Boolean literals are true or false.

questions.question: What is a variable?
questions.explanation: Variables store values in memory.

questions.question: Which property does a variable have?
questions.explanation: Variables have names, data types, and values.

questions.question: Which variable name follows good programming practice?
questions.explanation: Meaningful names improve readability.

questions.question: Which casing style capitalizes every word including the first?
questions.explanation: PascalCase capitalizes each word.

questions.question: Which casing style uses underscores?
questions.explanation: snake_case separates words with underscores.

questions.question: What is the scope of a variable?
questions.explanation: Scope defines where a variable is accessible.

questions.question: Which variable is accessible throughout the program?
questions.explanation: Global variables are accessible anywhere.

questions.question: Local variables are defined within?
questions.explanation: Local variables exist within specific blocks.

questions.question: What is a data type?
questions.explanation: Data types define how data is used and stored.

questions.question: Which data type holds whole numbers only?
questions.explanation: Integers store whole numbers.

questions.question: Which data type holds fractional values?
questions.explanation: Floating-point types store decimals.

questions.question: Which data type stores a single character?
questions.explanation: Character types store one character.

questions.question: Which data type has only two possible values?
questions.explanation: Boolean values are true or false.

questions.question: What does variable declaration do?
questions.explanation: Declaration allocates memory and associates type and name.

questions.question: What is variable initialization?
questions.explanation: Initialization assigns a value at declaration.

questions.question: What is an expression?
questions.explanation: Expressions evaluate to a value.

questions.question: Which is an arithmetic expression?
questions.explanation: Arithmetic expressions perform calculations.

questions.question: Which expression returns a Boolean value?
questions.explanation: Relational expressions return true or false.

questions.question: Which is a logical expression?
questions.explanation: Logical expressions combine conditions.

questions.question: Which expression assigns a value?
questions.explanation: Assignment expressions store values.

questions.question: Compound expressions involve?
questions.explanation: Compound expressions combine multiple expression types.

questions.question: Which function is shown as an example in expressions?
questions.explanation: pow(a, b) is used as an example in the slides.

questions.question: Which element improves code readability?
questions.explanation: Meaningful names improve readability.

questions.question: Why are constants useful?
questions.explanation: Constants help maintain consistent values.

questions.question: Which language does NOT require explicit data type declaration?
questions.explanation: Python infers data types automatically.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a defined constant?
questions.explanation: Defined constants are assigned to variables and reused.

questions.question: Why are constants important in programming?
questions.explanation: Constants prevent accidental value changes and improve readability.

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid variable name?
questions.explanation: Variable names must not be keywords or start with digits.

questions.question: Which rule violates variable naming conventions?
questions.explanation: Variable names must not start with digits.

questions.question: Which casing style capitalizes the first letter of every word?
questions.explanation: PascalCase capitalizes each word including the first.

questions.question: Which casing style starts with a lowercase letter and capitalizes subsequent words?
questions.explanation: camelCase starts with lowercase and capitalizes following words.

questions.question: Which casing style separates words using underscores?
questions.explanation: snake_case uses underscores between words.

questions.question: What determines how much memory a variable occupies?
questions.explanation: Data types determine memory size.

questions.question: Which data type would store a student's name?
questions.explanation: Strings store sequences of characters.

questions.question: Which data type would store a single letter grade?
questions.explanation: Character data type stores a single character.

questions.question: Which data type would best store exam scores like 75?
questions.explanation: Integers store whole numbers.

questions.question: Which data type would best store prices like 25.50?
questions.explanation: Floating point types store decimal values.

questions.question: Which statement about variable declaration is true?
options: Variables can be used before declaration
questions.explanation: Declaration allocates memory for variables.

questions.question: Which step assigns a value after declaration?
questions.explanation: Assignment gives a value to a declared variable.

questions.question: Which statement represents initialization?
questions.explanation: Initialization declares and assigns a value at once.

questions.question: Why must variables be declared before use?
options: To allocate memory and define type
questions.explanation: Declaration allows the compiler to allocate memory and understand usage.

questions.question: Which of the following is an arithmetic expression?
questions.explanation: Arithmetic expressions perform calculations.

questions.question: Which of the following is a relational expression?
questions.explanation: Relational expressions compare values.

questions.question: Which expression returns true or false?
questions.explanation: Logical expressions return Boolean values.

questions.question: Which of the following combines multiple expression types?
questions.explanation: Compound expressions combine different expression types.

questions.question: Which punctuation mark is used to terminate statements in languages like C++ and Java?
questions.explanation: Semicolons are used to end statements in many programming languages.

questions.question: Which punctuation mark separates elements such as function arguments?
questions.explanation: Commas separate elements in lists.

questions.question: Which punctuation mark is used to access members of a class or object?
questions.explanation: The period (dot) accesses class or object members.

questions.question: Quotation marks are mainly used to define?
questions.explanation: Quotation marks define string literals.

questions.question: What is syntax?
options: Rules governing how programs are written
The memory used by a program
questions.explanation: Syntax defines the grammatical rules of a programming language.

questions.question: Syntax controls the use of which of the following?
questions.explanation: Syntax governs how keywords, operators, and punctuation are used.

questions.question: Which statement about syntax is true?
options: All languages share the same syntax
Each language has its own syntax rules
questions.explanation: Each programming language has its own syntax rules.

questions.question: What is a character set?
options: A set of valid characters used in programs
questions.explanation: A character set defines valid characters in a programming language.

questions.question: Which of the following is part of a character set?
questions.explanation: Digits are part of the character set.

questions.question: Which of the following belongs to the special symbols category?
questions.explanation: Symbols like + are special characters.

questions.question: What is a constant?
options: A value that cannot be altered during execution
questions.explanation: Constants retain fixed values during execution.

questions.question: Which is a characteristic of constants?
questions.explanation: Constants cannot be changed once assigned.

questions.question: Which of the following is a numeric literal constant?
questions.explanation: 3.14 is a numeric literal.

questions.question: Which is an example of a defined constant?
questions.explanation: Defined constants are stored in variables.

questions.question: Why are constants useful in programs?
questions.explanation: Constants improve safety and reliability.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a variable?
questions.explanation: Variables store values that can change.

questions.question: Which variable naming practice is recommended?
questions.explanation: Meaningful names improve readability.

questions.question: What is the scope of a variable?
questions.explanation: Scope defines where a variable is accessible.

questions.question: Which variable is accessible throughout program execution?
questions.explanation: Global variables are accessible everywhere.

questions.question: Which variable is accessible only within a specific function or block?
questions.explanation: Local variables are limited to their block or function.

questions.question: Which element of a programming language defines the grammar rules?
questions.explanation: Syntax defines the grammar rules of a programming language.

questions.question: Which of the following is controlled by syntax rules?
questions.explanation: Syntax controls how keywords, operators, and punctuation are used.

questions.question: Which of the following is part of a programming language character set?
questions.explanation: Digits 0â€“9 are part of a character set.

questions.question: Which special symbol belongs to a character set?
questions.explanation: Special symbols like + are part of the character set.

questions.question: White spaces in a character set include?
questions.explanation: White spaces include spaces and tab characters.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of constant?
questions.explanation: The slides mention literal and defined constants only.

questions.question: Which constant type is written directly in code?
questions.explanation: Literal constants are typed directly into the program.

questions.question: Which of the following is a string literal?
questions.explanation: String literals are enclosed in quotation marks.

questions.question: Why do constants improve code safety?
questions.explanation: Constants prevent unintended modification of values.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines a variable?
options: A storage location whose value can change
questions.explanation: Variables store values that can change during execution.

questions.question: Which rule applies when naming variables?
questions.explanation: Variable names must use allowable characters from the character set.

questions.question: Which variable naming practice improves readability?
questions.explanation: Meaningful variable names improve code readability.

questions.question: Which variable scope allows access throughout program execution?
questions.explanation: Global variables are accessible throughout the program.

questions.question: Local variables are accessible within?
questions.explanation: Local variables are limited to specific blocks.

questions.question: Which data type classification tells the compiler how data is used?
questions.explanation: Data types classify how data is stored and used.

questions.question: Which data type stores both whole numbers and fractions?
questions.explanation: Floating point data types store decimal values.

questions.question: Which data type would store a programme of study?
questions.explanation: Strings store text such as names or programmes.

questions.question: What does declaring a variable associate?
questions.explanation: Declaration associates a type and a name.

questions.question: Which statement best describes variable initialization?
options: Using a variable without a value
questions.explanation: Initialization assigns a value at declaration.

questions.question: Which language infers data types from assigned values?
questions.explanation: Python infers variable data types.

questions.question: What is an expression composed of?
questions.explanation: Expressions consist of operators and operands.

questions.question: Which of the following is a relational expression?
questions.explanation: Relational expressions compare values.

questions.question: Which type of expression performs logical operations?
questions.explanation: Logical expressions perform logical operations.

questions.question: Which expression assigns the result to a variable?
questions.explanation: Assignment expressions store results in variables.

questions.question: Which expression type combines multiple expression forms?
questions.explanation: Compound expressions combine multiple expression types.

questions.question: Which operator type requires only one operand?
questions.explanation: Unary operators operate on a single operand.

questions.question: Which is an example of a unary operator?
questions.explanation: ++ is a unary increment operator.

questions.question: Prefix increment means?
questions.explanation: Prefix increment increases value before use.

questions.question: Postfix increment means?
questions.explanation: Postfix increment increases value after use.

questions.question: Which unary operators are commonly used in loops?
questions.explanation: Increment and decrement operators are commonly used in loops.
